title: Document Templates
description: Pre-built templates for legal documents, forms, and standard correspondence
quickStart: Select a template and click 'Use Template'
Fill in the template fields with case-specific information
Save the completed document to appropriate folder

interactiveElements.name: Rich Text Template Builder
interactiveElements.purpose: Create visually designed templates with rich formatting, tables, and variable insertion
interactiveElements.example: Design a professional letter with formatted text, tables, and {{client.name}} placeholders

interactiveElements.name: Upload DOCX
interactiveElements.purpose: Upload Word documents with variable placeholders for automatic template creation
interactiveElements.example: Upload a professionally designed Word document with {{client_name}} and {{case_number}} placeholders

interactiveElements.name: Field Builder
interactiveElements.purpose: Build templates using structured fields from system data
interactiveElements.example: Create forms with predefined client, case, and court fields

interactiveElements.name: JSON Editor
interactiveElements.purpose: Advanced template editing using raw JSON format
interactiveElements.example: Edit template schema directly for complete customization

interactiveElements.name: Template Categories
interactiveElements.purpose: Browse templates by type (Appeals, Notices, Replies, etc.)
interactiveElements.example: Click 'GST Appeals' to see all GST-related template forms

interactiveElements.name: Use Template Button
interactiveElements.purpose: Create a new document from selected template
interactiveElements.example: Generate a fresh GST Appeal form with pre-filled headers

interactiveElements.name: Preview Template
interactiveElements.example: See the layout and required fields of an appeal template

philosophy.title: Standardized Documentation
philosophy.description: Templates ensure consistency, compliance, and efficiency in legal document preparation

examples.scenario: Filing GST appeal with custom formatting
examples.solution: Use Rich Text Builder or Upload DOCX to create professionally formatted documents
examples.benefit: Maintains visual design while auto-populating case data

examples.solution: Upload DOCX templates designed in Microsoft Word with {{variable}} placeholders
examples.benefit: Leverage existing firm templates without recreating them

examples.benefit: Quick template creation with pre-mapped system fields
